2023-09-01.name: Minnesota State Fair
2023-09-01.summary: Try flights at the Craft Beer Hall, eat food on a stick, visit the Miracle of Birth barn, listen to free concerts and watch the 2 p.m. daily parade.

2023-09-01.name: Midwest Old Threshers Reunion
2023-09-01.summary: This gathering of steam engines and antique cars, trucks and tractors also features a horse pull, concerts, square dancing and a parade.

2023-09-01.name: Chicago Jazz Festival
2023-09-01.summary: This free festival features music at the Chicago Cultural Center and Millennium Park plus other venues.

2023-09-01.name: Western Minnesota Steam Threshers Reunion
2023-09-01.summary: Revel in the past during this show of antique machinery, which includes rides on trains and a carousel, square dancing, roving musicians and nightly jamborees.

2023-09-01.name: Wisconsin State Cow Chip Throw
2023-09-01.summary: There's chip-chucking contests in this Wisconsin River town, but also music, kids' games and an arts and crafts fair.

2023-09-01.name: Marquette Area Blues Fest
2023-09-01.summary: Enjoy a weekend of music in Mattson Lower Harbor Park on Lake Superior.

2023-09-01.name: Wilhelm Tell Festival
2023-09-01.summary: This Swiss town near Madison has been putting on an outdoor William Tell pageant since 1938. Festivities include a children's lantern parade, yodeling, an arts show and ethnic fashions.

2023-09-01.name: Wisconsin Highland Games
2023-09-01.summary: In addition to heavy athletics — throwing weights, hammers, logs and sacks of hay — there will be piping, drumming, dancing, longbow competitions, dog demonstrations and traditional Scottish food.

2023-09-01.name: Red Cliff Cultural Days
2023-09-01.summary: At this Ojibwe community just north of Bayfield, there will be a veterans' powwow, frybread-eating contest, canoe and kayak races, music and fireworks.

2023-09-02.name: Taste of Madison
2023-09-02.summary: This free benefit festival on Capitol Square includes 200 menu items from more than 80 restaurants, all priced at $1-$4. There's also music on three stages.

2023-09-02.name: Frankfort Fall Festival
2023-09-02.summary: The festival in this southern suburb of Chicago features more than 300 artisans, music, a carnival and a parade Sunday.

2023-09-02.name: Marina Fest
2023-09-02.summary: In this Door County village, there will be a vintage boat show, craft fair,  kids' carnival, music and Saturday fireworks.

2023-09-02.name: Fox Jazz Festival
2023-09-02.summary: This free Fox Cities jazz festival is in Jefferson Park, on the shores of Lake Winnebago.

2023-09-02.summary: At this Ojibwe community just north of Bayfield, there will be a veterans' powwow, frybread-eating contest, canoe and kayak races, music and fireworks.

2023-09-03.summary: The festival in this southern suburb of Chicago features more than 300 artisans, music, a carnival and a parade Sunday.

2023-09-03.name: Fox Valley Folk Music & Storytelling Festival
2023-09-03.summary: Musicians and storytellers perform on eight stages at this festival in Island Park on the Fox River.

2023-09-03.name: Bike the Drive
2023-09-03.summary: Along a 30-mile loop, ride car-free on Lake Shore Drive, with a post-ride festival in Grant Park.

2023-09-03.name: Marquette Area Blues Fest
2023-09-03.summary: Enjoy a weekend of music in Mattson Lower Harbor Park on Lake Superior.

2023-09-03.name: Kites Over Lake Michigan
2023-09-03.summary: On Neshotah Beach, watch giant kites, precision stunt teams, a release of sky lanterns and fireworks. There will be live music Saturday night and free kite-making for kids on Saturday.

2023-09-03.name: Wilhelm Tell Festival
2023-09-03.summary: This Swiss town near Madison has been putting on an outdoor William Tell pageant since 1938. Festivities include a children's lantern parade, yodeling, an arts show and ethnic fashions.

2023-09-03.summary: In addition to heavy athletics — throwing weights, hammers, logs and sacks of hay — there will be piping, drumming, dancing, longbow competitions, dog demonstrations and traditional Scottish food.

2023-09-03.summary: This free Fox Cities jazz festival is in Jefferson Park, on the shores of Lake Winnebago.

2023-09-04.summary: Try flights at the Craft Beer Hall, eat food on a stick, visit the Miracle of Birth barn, listen to free concerts and watch the 2 p.m. daily parade.

2023-09-04.name: Midwest Old Threshers Reunion
2023-09-04.summary: This gathering of steam engines and antique cars, trucks and tractors also features a horse pull, concerts, square dancing and a parade.

2023-09-04.name: Western Minnesota Steam Threshers Reunion
2023-09-04.summary: Revel in the past during this show of antique machinery, which includes rides on trains and a carousel, square dancing, roving musicians and nightly jamborees.

2023-09-04.name: Frankfort Fall Festival
2023-09-04.summary: The festival in this southern suburb of Chicago features more than 300 artisans, music, a carnival and a parade Sunday.

2023-09-04.name: Fox Valley Folk Music & Storytelling Festival
2023-09-04.summary: Musicians and storytellers perform on eight stages at this festival in Island Park on the Fox River.

2023-09-04.name: Mackinac Bridge Walk
2023-09-04.summary: Once a year, on Labor Day, people can walk across the five-mile span, the third-longest suspension bridge in the world.

2023-09-04.name: Wilhelm Tell Festival
2023-09-04.summary: This Swiss town near Madison has been putting on an outdoor William Tell pageant since 1938. Festivities include a children's lantern parade, yodeling, an arts show and ethnic fashions.

2023-09-04.name: Marina Fest
2023-09-04.summary: In this Door County village, there will be a vintage boat show, craft fair,  kids' carnival, music and Saturday fireworks.

2023-09-04.name: BeatleFest
2023-09-04.summary: The Spring Green General Store hosts this outdoor tribute to the Fab Four, with Beatles music performed all day.

2023-09-16.name: Party on the Pavement
2023-09-16.summary: Racine's biggest street festival features stages of entertainment and a car show, art walk, carnival rides and zones for kids and sports.

2023-09-16.name: Pumpkin Festival
2023-09-16.summary: This town near Peoria, home of the Libby's pumpkin-packing plant, calls itself the Pumpkin Capital of the World. The festival features pumpkin-boat races, pumpkin decorating, pie-eating contests, a craft fair, a pumpkin-pancake breakfast and a 10:30 a.m. Saturday parade.

2023-09-16.name: Michigan Irish Music Festival
2023-09-16.summary: There's music on three stages, plus dance and session tents, a cultural village, Celtic Kitchen and limerick contest.

2023-09-16.name: Mississippi Valley Blues Festival
2023-09-16.summary: In LeClaire Park on the river, blues musicians celebrate the music that traveled up the Mississippi.

2023-09-16.name: Oktoberfestival
2023-09-16.summary: This festival on the bayfront features stein-holding, barrel-rolling and pretzel-tossing contests, a kids' zone and a dachshund derby on Sunday, plus German food and music. Admission is $20, $10 up to week of event, free for youths 15 and under.

2023-09-16.name: Wo-Zha-Wa Days
2023-09-16.summary: There's a juried arts and crafts show, a flea market, a street carnival and a parade Sunday.

2023-09-16.name: Wauktoberfest
2023-09-16.summary: This town just north of Madison celebrates with a craft-beer tasting, bike tour, music and lots of contests: frau carrying, yodeling, beer keg race, dachshund dash and Limburger cheese and sauerkraut eating.

2023-09-16.name: Gemuetlichkeit Days
2023-09-16.summary: This festival between Madison and Milwaukee is named for the German word for a cozy and congenial atmosphere. It includes sauerkraut-eating, nail-driving, facial hair and costume contests, a vintage car show, music and a parade at noon Sunday.

2023-09-16.name: Riot Fest
2023-09-16.summary: This Douglas Park music festival also features a circus sideshow revue and carnival.

2023-09-16.name: Hot Air Balloon Days
2023-09-16.summary: In this town southwest of Des Moines, there are balloon races and night glows, a parade with marching-band contest, an arts and crafts fair and a flea market.

2023-09-16.name: Mahkato Wacipi
2023-09-16.summary: This traditional powwow in Land of Memories Park commemorates the 38 Dakota who were hanged after the 1862 U.S.-Dakota war.

2023-09-16.name: Apple Days
2023-09-16.summary: On the shore of Lake Minnetonka, there's a history tour, apple pie-eating contest, music and a street dance.

2023-09-16.name: Wine & Harvest Festival
2023-09-16.summary: There's a pumpkin regatta — yes, people paddling hollowed-out pumpkins across Cedar Creek — at the fest in this historic mill town just north of Milwaukee. There's also a scarecrow contest, grape stomp, hay rides, juried arts fair and lots of food.

2023-09-16.name: Scarecrow Fest
2023-09-16.summary: See early fall color around this town in Nicolet National Forest. There's pumpkin-chucking, pumpkin and scarecrow contests, a craft fair, car show, hay rides and free chili and deep-fried pickles.

2023-09-16.name: Willy Street Fair
2023-09-16.summary: This street fair on Williamson Street on the isthmus features food, vendors, music on three stages and a parade at 11 a.m. Sunday.

2023-09-16.name: Harvest Fest & Street Art Auction
2023-09-16.summary: This street party includes a car show, cornhole and chalk-art contests, music and artisans and winds up with the auction of 25 artist-created cherries.

2023-09-16.name: Squid Fest
2023-09-16.summary: The festival in this Minnesota River Valley town features a pop-up sculpture garden on Main Street, art installations, a disc golf tournament, street performance, kids' activities, and live music all day. There's also a Ribfest.

2023-09-16.name: Grape Stomp
2023-09-16.summary: Carlos Creek Winery hosts this festival, which features music on two stages, an art fair, grape stomps and "I Love Lucy'' look-alike contests.

2023-09-16.name: Oktoberfest
2023-09-16.summary: Expect entertainment on four stages, kids' activities, keg-rolling, sauerkraut-eating and stein-holding contests and a parade at 3 p.m. Saturday.

2023-09-16.name: Vintage Illinois at the Canal Market
2023-09-16.summary: Sample wine from more than 25 wineries and listen to music at this festival near Starved Rock State Park.

2023-09-16.name: Unplugged music festival
2023-09-16.summary: The harbor-side North House Folk School celebrates with storytelling, traditional workshops, an artisan marketplace and  concerts by songwriter/musicians.

2023-09-16.name: Autumn Trail
2023-09-16.summary: In Lanesboro and the other towns along the Root River Valley State Trail in southeast Minnesota,  enjoy music, wagon rides and free samples from local restaurants and growers.

2023-09-16.name: Audubon Days
2023-09-16.summary: The festival in this town next to big Horicon Marsh features bed races, a car show, craft fair, bag tournament and music.

2023-09-16.name: Bay View Bash
2023-09-16.summary: This street festival in the Bay View neighborhood includes music on four stages, a children's area, cooking demonstrations and a strong man competition.

2023-09-16.name: Parade of Nations and Multicultural Festival
2023-09-16.summary: The parade begins in Hancock and ends in Houghton at Dee Stadium, where there's a festival with music, dancing and food from around the world.

2023-09-16.name: All-State Barn Tour in Iowa
2023-09-16.summary: It's the Iowa Barn Foundation's annual             free, self-guided tour of restored historic barns.

2023-09-06.name: Defeat of Jesse James Days
2023-09-06.summary: In this college town south of the Twin Cities, there's a fine-arts festival, tractor pulls, a bike tour, reenactments of the famous bank raid and a Sunday parade.

2023-09-06.name: Sandwich Fair
2023-09-06.summary: This northeast Illinois fair, held since 1888, features exhibits, entertainment and music plus harness racing, tractor pulls and demolition derbies.

2023-09-07.name: Defeat of Jesse James Days
2023-09-07.summary: In this college town south of the Twin Cities, there's a fine-arts festival, tractor pulls, a bike tour, reenactments of the famous bank raid and a Sunday parade.

2023-09-07.name: Sandwich Fair
2023-09-07.summary: This northeast Illinois fair, held since 1888, features exhibits, entertainment and music plus harness racing, tractor pulls and demolition derbies.

2023-09-08.name: Defeat of Jesse James Days
2023-09-08.summary: In this college town south of the Twin Cities, there's a fine-arts festival, tractor pulls, a bike tour, reenactments of the famous bank raid and a Sunday parade.

2023-09-08.name: Sandwich Fair
2023-09-08.summary: This northeast Illinois fair, held since 1888, features exhibits, entertainment and music plus harness racing, tractor pulls and demolition derbies.

2023-09-08.name: James J. Hill Days
2023-09-08.summary: This Minneapolis suburb features a street market and carnival, dachshund races, a craft-beer fest, logrolling and fireworks on Saturday and a parade on Sunday.

2023-09-08.name: Villa Louis Carriage Classic
2023-09-08.summary: The Victorian estate on the Mississippi River hosts horses, restored carriages and drivers in period dress for competitive arena and cross-country sport driving, a passion of the frontier aristocrats who built it.

2023-09-08.name: Harvest Moon Festival
2023-09-08.summary: In Whiteside Park, there's an arts fair plus music, an old-time medicine show and pony rides and a petting zoo for kids.

2023-09-08.name: Radio Waves Music Festival
2023-09-08.summary: WTIP, North Shore Community Radio, hosts this outdoor fest of more than 25 local and regional music acts next to the municipal campground.

2023-09-08.name: Taste of Chicago
2023-09-08.summary: The city's big sampling festival returns to Grant Park at the end of summer.

2023-09-08.name: Festa Italiana
2023-09-08.summary: The longtime festival has moved to the  Italian Community Center and features food, music, dance and a bocce ball tournament.

2023-09-08.name: Paw Paw Wine & Harvest Festival
2023-09-08.summary: This big festival in southwest Michigan wine country features music on three stages, Friday fireworks, an art fair, motorcycle and bicycle tours, grape stomps and a Sunday parade.

2023-09-08.name: Festival of the Vine
2023-09-08.summary: There's an arts and crafts show, flower market, music, wine tasting and sampling of food from local restaurants.

2023-09-09.name: Defeat of Jesse James Days
2023-09-09.summary: In this college town south of the Twin Cities, there's a fine-arts festival, tractor pulls, a bike tour, reenactments of the famous bank raid and a Sunday parade.

2023-09-09.name: Harvest Moon Festival
2023-09-09.summary: In Whiteside Park, there's an arts fair plus music, an old-time medicine show and pony rides and a petting zoo for kids.

2023-09-09.name: Grand Rapids Riverfest
2023-09-09.summary: This music festival downtown features nationally known rock and folk acts.

2023-09-09.name: Little Falls Arts & Crafts Fair
2023-09-09.summary: This large fair, with nearly 600 artists, includes a car show and an antiques and collectibles section as well as a Man Cave.

2023-09-09.name: Mural Fest
2023-09-09.summary: Go on guided tours of Ashland's famous murals, meet the artists and go on a mural scavenger hunt. There's also food, music, crafts and a car show.

2023-09-09.name: Festival of Arts and Gallery Tour
2023-09-09.summary: This juried art show, in Memorial Park on the shore of Lake Superior, includes a live art auction and a tour of studios and galleries, with artist demonstrations.

2023-09-09.name: Radio Waves Music Festival
2023-09-09.summary: WTIP, North Shore Community Radio, hosts this outdoor fest of more than 25 local and regional music acts next to the municipal campground.

2023-09-09.name: Ethnic Fest
2023-09-09.summary: Alphornists, Scandinavian dancers and Anishinaabe drum and dance corps perform in this town on the shores of Leech Lake. There's also a parade.

2023-09-09.name: Taste of Chicago
2023-09-09.summary: The city's big sampling festival returns to Grant Park at the end of summer.

2023-09-09.name: Festa Italiana
2023-09-09.summary: The longtime festival has moved to the  Italian Community Center and features food, music, dance and a bocce ball tournament.

2023-09-09.name: Paw Paw Wine & Harvest Festival
2023-09-09.summary: This big festival in southwest Michigan wine country features music on three stages, Friday fireworks, an art fair, motorcycle and bicycle tours, grape stomps and a Sunday parade.

2023-09-09.name: Festival of the Vine
2023-09-09.summary: There's an arts and crafts show, flower market, music, wine tasting and sampling of food from local restaurants.

2023-09-09.name: East Troy Bluegrass Festival
2023-09-09.summary: Listen to bluegrass bands and contests in the historic village square. There's also a food court and marketplace.

2023-09-09.name: Rock Bend Folk Festival
2023-09-09.summary: This free, easygoing festival is in this Minnesota River town's Minnesota Square Park.

2023-09-09.name: Washington County Bluegrass Festival
2023-09-09.summary: Bluegrass bands will play at this family festival at Lake Elmo Park Reserve at the eastern edge of the Twin Cities, free with $7 vehicle permit. There also will be camping and food vendors.

2023-09-09.name: Sputnikfest
2023-09-09.summary: Help celebrate the 1962 crash landing of a 20-pound piece of Russia's Sputnik on a street in Manitowoc. There's a wacky costume contest, a Miss Space Debris pageant, a pet costume contest, a space-themed movie and music.

2023-09-09.name: Monarch Festival
2023-09-09.summary: This festival at Lake Nokomis celebrates the monarch migration from Minnesota to Mexico and includes a costume parade, music, dance, art activities and monarch games.

2023-09-09.name: Greenway Glow
2023-09-09.summary: Along the five-mile Midtown Greenway bike route in south Minneapolis, enjoy live music, art installations and theatrical performances between 4 and 10 p.m.

2023-09-09.name: Laura Ingalls Wilder Days
2023-09-09.summary: The famous author's birthplace celebrates  with a festival at the Laura Ingalls Wilder Museum, including traditional music and crafts, pie-eating and fiddling.

2023-09-10.name: Defeat of Jesse James Days

2023-09-10.name: St. Paul Classic Bike Tour
2023-09-10.summary: Ride a 15- or 31-mile route along the Mississippi, lakes Como and Phalen and St. Paul parkways, starting and ending at Como Park Pavilion and punctuated by food and live music.

2023-09-10.name: Scandinavian Day
2023-09-10.summary: This festival in Vasa Park, along the Fox River, features music, dancing, food and crafts from the Nordic countries.

2023-09-10.name: Festival of Arts and Gallery Tour
2023-09-10.summary: This juried art show, in Memorial Park on the shore of Lake Superior, includes a live art auction and a tour of studios and galleries, with artist demonstrations.

2023-09-15.name: Hot Air Balloon Days
2023-09-15.summary: In this town southwest of Des Moines, there are balloon races and night glows, a parade with marching-band contest, an arts and crafts fair and a flea market.

2023-09-15.name: Mahkato Wacipi
2023-09-15.summary: This traditional powwow in Land of Memories Park commemorates the 38 Dakota who were hanged after the 1862 U.S.-Dakota war.

2023-09-15.name: Grape Stomp
2023-09-15.summary: Carlos Creek Winery hosts this festival, which features music on two stages, an art fair, grape stomps and "I Love Lucy'' look-alike contests.

2023-09-15.name: Oktoberfest
2023-09-15.summary: Expect entertainment on four stages, kids' activities, keg-rolling, sauerkraut-eating and stein-holding contests and a parade at 3 p.m. Saturday.

2023-09-15.name: Unplugged music festival
2023-09-15.summary: The harbor-side North House Folk School celebrates with storytelling, traditional workshops, an artisan marketplace and  concerts by songwriter/musicians.

2023-09-15.name: Audubon Days
2023-09-15.summary: The festival in this town next to big Horicon Marsh features bed races, a car show, craft fair, bag tournament and music.

2023-09-17.name: Michigan Irish Music Festival
2023-09-17.summary: There's music on three stages, plus dance and session tents, a cultural village, Celtic Kitchen and limerick contest.

2023-09-17.name: Oktoberfestival
2023-09-17.summary: This festival on the bayfront features stein-holding, barrel-rolling and pretzel-tossing contests, a kids' zone and a dachshund derby on Sunday, plus German food and music. Admission is $20, $10 up to week of event, free for youths 15 and under.

2023-09-17.name: Wo-Zha-Wa Days
2023-09-17.summary: There's a juried arts and crafts show, a flea market, a street carnival and a parade Sunday.

2023-09-17.name: Wauktoberfest
2023-09-17.summary: This town just north of Madison celebrates with a craft-beer tasting, bike tour, music and lots of contests: frau carrying, yodeling, beer keg race, dachshund dash and Limburger cheese and sauerkraut eating.

2023-09-17.name: Gemuetlichkeit Days
2023-09-17.summary: This festival between Madison and Milwaukee is named for the German word for a cozy and congenial atmosphere. It includes sauerkraut-eating, nail-driving, facial hair and costume contests, a vintage car show, music and a parade at noon Sunday.

2023-09-17.name: Riot Fest
2023-09-17.summary: This Douglas Park music festival also features a circus sideshow revue and carnival.

2023-09-17.name: Hot Air Balloon Days
2023-09-17.summary: In this town southwest of Des Moines, there are balloon races and night glows, a parade with marching-band contest, an arts and crafts fair and a flea market.

2023-09-17.name: Mahkato Wacipi
2023-09-17.summary: This traditional powwow in Land of Memories Park commemorates the 38 Dakota who were hanged after the 1862 U.S.-Dakota war.

2023-09-17.name: Apple Days
2023-09-17.summary: On the shore of Lake Minnetonka, there's a history tour, apple pie-eating contest, music and a street dance.

2023-09-17.name: Wine & Harvest Festival
2023-09-17.summary: There's a pumpkin regatta — yes, people paddling hollowed-out pumpkins across Cedar Creek — at the fest in this historic mill town just north of Milwaukee. There's also a scarecrow contest, grape stomp, hay rides, juried arts fair and lots of food.

2023-09-17.name: Willy Street Fair
2023-09-17.summary: This street fair on Williamson Street on the isthmus features food, vendors, music on three stages and a parade at 11 a.m. Sunday.

2023-09-17.name: Grape Stomp
2023-09-17.summary: Carlos Creek Winery hosts this festival, which features music on two stages, an art fair, grape stomps and "I Love Lucy'' look-alike contests.

2023-09-17.name: Vintage Illinois at the Canal Market
2023-09-17.summary: Sample wine from more than 25 wineries and listen to music at this festival near Starved Rock State Park.

2023-09-17.name: Unplugged music festival
2023-09-17.summary: The harbor-side North House Folk School celebrates with storytelling, traditional workshops, an artisan marketplace and  concerts by songwriter/musicians.

2023-09-17.name: Audubon Days
2023-09-17.summary: The festival in this town next to big Horicon Marsh features bed races, a car show, craft fair, bag tournament and music.

2023-09-17.name: All-State Barn Tour in Iowa
2023-09-17.summary: It's the Iowa Barn Foundation's annual             free, self-guided tour of restored historic barns.

2023-09-21.name: Boats and Bluegrass
2023-09-21.summary: This family-oriented festival in Prairie Island Park, on the Mississippi River, features disc golf and paddling as well as music. A weekend pass includes camping and canoeing, and kids under 16 are free with an adult ticket. Buy tickets early to save money.

2023-09-21.name: Oktoberfest
2023-09-21.summary: There will be music, wagon rides, chainsaw carving, children's activities and, of course, beer from New Glarus Brewing.

2023-09-21.name: Fall Rendezvous
2023-09-21.summary: At the Ermatinger Clergue National Historic Site near the Soo Locks, see War of 1812 reenactments, musket demonstrations, cannon fire and living history.

2023-09-22.name: Boats and Bluegrass
2023-09-22.summary: This family-oriented festival in Prairie Island Park, on the Mississippi River, features disc golf and paddling as well as music. A weekend pass includes camping and canoeing, and kids under 16 are free with an adult ticket. Buy tickets early to save money.

2023-09-22.name: Oktoberfest
2023-09-22.summary: There will be music, wagon rides, chainsaw carving, children's activities and, of course, beer from New Glarus Brewing.

2023-09-22.name: German Fest
2023-09-22.summary: There will be music, dancing, children's             games and lock and dam tours in this antebellum town on the Mississippi River.

2023-09-22.name: Cranberry Festival
2023-09-22.summary: At this huge festival in west-central Wisconsin, there'll be marsh tours, pie-eating contests and more than 1,000 booths selling antiques, produce and arts and crafts.

2023-09-22.name: Oktoberfest
2023-09-22.summary: Take polka-dancing lessons, enter the Bier Maiden or stein-holding contests and win costume prizes at this outdoor fest under tents  downtown.

2023-09-22.name: Apple Festival
2023-09-22.summary: There'll be arts and crafts and music in this southwest Wisconsin village. The big parade is Sunday.

2023-09-22.name: World Music Festival
2023-09-22.summary: More than 30 artists and ensembles from 22 countries perform at the Chicago Cultural Center and other venues.

2023-09-22.name: Bacon Bash
2023-09-22.summary: There will be eating contests, pig crafts, an amateur bacon cook-off and many bacon dishes, including ice cream.

2023-09-22.name: Fall Rendezvous
2023-09-22.summary: At the Ermatinger Clergue National Historic Site near the Soo Locks, see War of 1812 reenactments, musket demonstrations, cannon fire and living history.

2023-09-23.name: Boats and Bluegrass
2023-09-23.summary: This family-oriented festival in Prairie Island Park, on the Mississippi River, features disc golf and paddling as well as music. A weekend pass includes camping and canoeing, and kids under 16 are free with an adult ticket. Buy tickets early to save money.

2023-09-23.name: Oktoberfest
2023-09-23.summary: There will be music, wagon rides, chainsaw carving, children's activities and, of course, beer from New Glarus Brewing.

2023-09-23.name: German Fest
2023-09-23.summary: There will be music, dancing, children's             games and lock and dam tours in this antebellum town on the Mississippi River.

2023-09-23.name: Cranberry Festival
2023-09-23.summary: At this huge festival in west-central Wisconsin, there'll be marsh tours, pie-eating contests and more than 1,000 booths selling antiques, produce and arts and crafts.

2023-09-23.name: Oktoberfest
2023-09-23.summary: Take polka-dancing lessons, enter the Bier Maiden or stein-holding contests and win costume prizes at this outdoor fest under tents  downtown.

2023-09-23.name: Apple Festival
2023-09-23.summary: There'll be arts and crafts and music in this southwest Wisconsin village. The big parade is Sunday.

2023-09-23.name: World Music Festival
2023-09-23.summary: More than 30 artists and ensembles from 22 countries perform at the Chicago Cultural Center and other venues.

2023-09-23.name: Bacon Bash
2023-09-23.summary: There will be eating contests, pig crafts, an amateur bacon cook-off and many bacon dishes, including ice cream.

2023-09-23.name: Fall Rendezvous
2023-09-23.summary: At the Ermatinger Clergue National Historic Site near the Soo Locks, see War of 1812 reenactments, musket demonstrations, cannon fire and living history.

2023-09-23.name: Autumn Trail
2023-09-23.summary: In Lanesboro and the other towns along the Root River Valley State Trail in southeast Minnesota,  enjoy music, wagon rides and free samples from local restaurants and growers.

2023-09-23.name: Northside Oktoberfest
2023-09-23.summary: The Iowa City Brewfest is part of this festival, which includes keg  bowling, beer sliding and nail-striking as well as traditional Oktoberfest music in an outdoor beer hall.

2023-09-23.name: Art and Artists Celebration
2023-09-23.summary: The 43-acre Franconia Sculpture Park is holding its annual celebration, with bands, food trucks and sculpture tours.  It's at the intersection of U.S. 8 and Minnesota 95, between Shafer and Taylors Falls.

2023-09-23.name: Spirit of the St. Croix Art Festival
2023-09-23.summary: There will be music, food and a juried art show along the St. Croix River, in Lakefront Park.

2023-09-23.name: Hyde Park Jazz Festival
2023-09-23.summary: Listen to non-stop music during this free festival at venues in and around Midway Plaisance, near the Museum of Science and Industry and Lake Michigan.

2023-09-23.name: Iowa's Latino Heritage Festival
2023-09-23.summary: This festival at Western Gateway Park features Latino music, dancing, arts, cultural booths, children's activities and a corn-eating contest.

2023-09-23.name: Fall Festival
2023-09-23.summary: There's an arts and crafts fair, children's games, contests and live music downtown.

2023-09-23.name: Doors Open Milwaukee
2023-09-23.summary: More than 125 historic buildings — theaters, breweries, mansions, cathedrals, hotels, museums — are open to the public, and many offer free guided tours.

2023-09-24.name: Boats and Bluegrass
2023-09-24.summary: This family-oriented festival in Prairie Island Park, on the Mississippi River, features disc golf and paddling as well as music. A weekend pass includes camping and canoeing, and kids under 16 are free with an adult ticket. Buy tickets early to save money.

2023-09-24.name: Oktoberfest
2023-09-24.summary: There will be music, wagon rides, chainsaw carving, children's activities and, of course, beer from New Glarus Brewing.

2023-09-24.name: Cranberry Festival
2023-09-24.summary: At this huge festival in west-central Wisconsin, there'll be marsh tours, pie-eating contests and more than 1,000 booths selling antiques, produce and arts and crafts.

2023-09-24.name: Apple Festival
2023-09-24.summary: There'll be arts and crafts and music in this southwest Wisconsin village. The big parade is Sunday.

2023-09-24.name: World Music Festival
2023-09-24.summary: More than 30 artists and ensembles from 22 countries perform at the Chicago Cultural Center and other venues.

2023-09-24.name: Fall Rendezvous
2023-09-24.summary: At the Ermatinger Clergue National Historic Site near the Soo Locks, see War of 1812 reenactments, musket demonstrations, cannon fire and living history.

2023-09-24.name: Spirit of the St. Croix Art Festival
2023-09-24.summary: There will be music, food and a juried art show along the St. Croix River, in Lakefront Park.

2023-09-24.name: Hyde Park Jazz Festival
2023-09-24.summary: Listen to non-stop music during this free festival at venues in and around Midway Plaisance, near the Museum of Science and Industry and Lake Michigan.

2023-09-24.name: Iowa's Latino Heritage Festival
2023-09-24.summary: This festival at Western Gateway Park features Latino music, dancing, arts, cultural booths, children's activities and a corn-eating contest.

2023-09-24.name: Doors Open Milwaukee
2023-09-24.summary: More than 125 historic buildings — theaters, breweries, mansions, cathedrals, hotels, museums — are open to the public, and many offer free guided tours.

2023-09-30.name: Octoberfest
2023-09-30.summary: This large downtown festival is more general civic celebration than German  festival, with an arts and crafts show, car show and music on five  stages.

2023-09-30.name: Beef-A-Rama
2023-09-30.summary: In this northern Wisconsin lake-resort town, there's a Rump Roast Run, beef-eating contest and Parade of Beef.

2023-09-30.name: Grundy County Corn Festival
2023-09-30.summary: The festival in this town on the Illinois River between Ottawa and Joliet offers stagecoach and train rides, a crackerbox derby, a pie-eating contest, music, a carnival, Saturday fireworks and a parade at 2 p.m. Sunday.

2023-09-30.name: Oktoberfest
2023-09-30.summary: At this big riverfront festival, there's food, music and carnival rides, plus the opening Torchlight Parade and the Maple Leaf Parade on Saturday morning.

2023-09-30.name: Northeast Iowa Artists' Studio Tour
2023-09-30.summary: Drive through scenic bluff country to see 35 artists at 27 sites around Decorah, Burr Oak, St. Lucas, Waukon, West Union, Cresco, New Albin, Lansing, Elgin and Clermont.

2023-09-30.name: Door County Fall Lighthouse Festival
2023-09-30.summary: The Door County Maritime Museum sponsors tours by air, land and water to lighthouses on the peninsula, some of which can be visited only during festival weekends. Reserve as early as possible.

2023-09-30.name: Fall Fest
2023-09-30.summary: In the colorful northwest Wisconsin woods, there'll be hay rides, corn maze, a chili cook-off, fish boil, arts and crafts and fireworks.

2023-09-30.name: Oktoberfest
2023-09-30.summary: There's German music and food at this Amana Colonies village, plus contests that include the Eisenmann, or Iron Man, competition: Teams roll kegs, walk a balance beam with full steins of beer and saw logs. The parade is at 10 a.m. Saturday.

2023-09-30.name: Oktoberfest
2023-09-30.summary: The Lions Club puts on this riverfront festival, which includes wiener-dog races, polka lessons, nail-driving, pumpkin-decorating and a beanbag tournament.

2023-09-30.name: World Music Festival
2023-09-30.summary: More than 30 artists and ensembles from 22 countries perform at the Chicago Cultural Center and other venues.

2023-09-30.name: World War II Days
2023-09-30.summary: Midway Village Museum hosts one of the largest World War II battle re-enactments in the nation, with more than 1,200 uniformed re-enactors and more than 60 vintage tanks and other armored vehicles.

2023-09-30.name: Kalona Fall Festival
2023-09-30.summary: This Mennonite community just southwest of Iowa City, famous for its quilts, offers pony rides, a pumpkin-carving contest, demonstrations of Old World artisanry, music and homemade potato chips, apple fritters, ice cream and chicken, biscuits and gravy.

2023-09-30.name: Harvest Fair
2023-09-30.summary: This free festival at the Wisconsin State Fairgrounds features lumberjack shows, pumpkin bowling, scarecrow-making, kids' rides and entertainment on three stages.

2023-09-30.name: Johnny Appleseed Festival
2023-09-30.summary: In this northwest suburb of Chicago, there's pumpkin bowling, a pumpkin train and petting zoo, apple contests, music and a craft fair.

2023-09-30.name: Fall Village Market
2023-09-30.summary: This town west of Madison offers vintage and handmade goods, live music and food trucks.

2023-09-27.name: Grundy County Corn Festival
2023-09-27.summary: The festival in this town on the Illinois River between Ottawa and Joliet offers stagecoach and train rides, a crackerbox derby, a pie-eating contest, music, a carnival, Saturday fireworks and a parade at 2 p.m. Sunday.

2023-09-27.summary: More than 30 artists and ensembles from 22 countries perform at the Chicago Cultural Center and other venues.
